greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 3p - q where p and q are consecutive primes.
comment: Except for the initial term, a(n)=={2, 4} mod 6.
Not monotonic: a(29) = 214 > 212 = a(30), a(33) = 272 > 268 = a(34), etc. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 03 2013
formula: a(n) ~ 2n log n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 03 2013
results.author: _Giovanni Teofilatto_, Sep 30 2004
ext: Corrected (116 duplicated) by _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 22 2010
